general_advisory:
As per the extended range forecast of IMD, MC, Bhubaneswar, minimum temperature (night temperature) very likely to be 18-20°C in some parts of South Odisha, 14-16°C in most parts of Coastal Odisha and some parts of Interior Odisha and 10-14°C over the remaining parts of Interior Odisha during week-1 (20th to 26th December, 2024). Minimum temperature very likely to be normal to above normal over the districts of Odisha and very light to light rain very likely to occur over Coastal Odisha & adjoining districts of Interior Odisha during that period. Overall Rainfall activity very likely to be normal to above normal over the state during week-1.
Minimum temperature (night temperature) very likely to be 16-18°C in some parts of South Odisha, 14-16°C in most parts of Coastal Odisha and some parts of Interior Odisha, and 10-14°C over the remaining parts of Interior Odisha during week-2 (27th December, 2024 to 02nd January, 2025). Minimum temperature very likely to be normal over the state during week-2. Dry weather likely to prevail over Odisha during that period.
Looking to the above mentioned weather condition, farmers are advised to conduct harvesting, sowing, and spraying operations accordingly. Farmers are advised to make provision to take proper care of crops as well as animals to protect them from cold. Farmers are advised to complete the sowing of Rabi crops like Mustard, Til, Chickpea, Groundnut, Green gram/Black Gram etc. and start nursery sowing of Summer Paddy where irrigation facilities are available.

advisory: There is some rainfall event is expected in the first half of the upcoming days so farmers are advised to wait some days for harvesting operations and make provision to keep the harvested paddy crop in safe places to avoid any further damage.

Use 'Super Grain Bag' for safe storage of paddy/rice for a longer period of time or store the harvested paddy in properly bagged and stacked with a suitable cover to avoid damage due to untimely rain.

Farmers should start field preparation for summer season rice cultivation. For this purpose, farmers may select some improved varieties like MTU 1010, MTU 1156, MTU 1001, Lalat, Improved Lalat, Chandan, Swarna, etc.
One week before sowing of green gram/black gram crop, seed should be treated with carbendazim @ 1.5-2.0g and imidacloprid @ 5g per kg seeds.
Seed should be sown with a seed rate of 8-10 kg/ac with a spacing of 30cm×10cm.
Varieties: Green Gram - Kamadeva, Durga, IPM 02-3, IPM 02-14, TARM1. Black Gram - Prasada, Usala, PU 31, IPU2-43, Mahuri
Avoid irrigation for some days because some amount of rainfall is expected in the upcoming week.

Farmers who have not yet sown seeds can use improved Groundnut varieties such as TAG-24, JL-24, Girnar-3, Smruti, TG-3, TG-22, Kadri-5, Kadri-6, Kadri-9, TPG-41, GPBD-4, Devi, CO-7, Dharani, and Divya etc.
Ensure seed treatment before sowing of seed and if possible, treat with bacteria or phospho culture 7 days after treatment.
Straw can be used as mulching material in vegetable crops to maintain soil moisture as well as soil temperature in the field during the winter season.
Regular monitoring against the attack of Diamond back moth in cauliflower should be advised and if possible, farmers should use a pheromone trap in the field for this purpose.
If the attack is observed then spraying of neem oil @ 5 ml or Emamectin Benzoate @ 0.4 g per liter water should be advised after the occurrence of rain.

Farmers should make provision to protect the animal from cold (if possible use a jute bag to cover the animal and straw as bedding material) during the winter season and provide clean drinking water to cattle and keep their sheds clean.
Vaccination and deworming should be done to control different harmful diseases and stomach worms.
Proper ventilation is required to provide fresh air and removing gases inside the house.
External heat source is provided to keep the poultry shed warm and dry. Various types and layers of curtains and jute bags are used to insulate the farm.
The drinking water should be maintained at a suitable temperature to promote water intake.
